alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 12:22AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, Mingo, southern Putnam, Lincoln, Logan and northwestern Boone Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1221 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winfield to Gill to near Oppy. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Williamson, Madison, Logan, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Marmet, Chapmanville, Poca, Delbarton, Ranger, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Harts and Cross Lanes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 114. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 37 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 91 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Putnam
